title: fix: bundle OpenTelemetry data at build time for Cloudflare Workers compatibility
description:
## Summary

This PR fixes Cloudflare Workers deployment errors and improves the codebase by bundling OpenTelemetry data at build time and adding proper TypeScript types for tool definitions.

### Changes

**Bug Fixes:**
- Bundle OpenTelemetry namespace data at build time to avoid Node.js file system APIs in Cloudflare Workers
- Fix namespace key generation to replace all hyphens (not just the first) for consistent lookups
- Remove unnecessary type annotations where TypeScript can infer types

**Features:**
- Add native TypeScript types for tool definitions, eliminating type casting in the UI
- Simplify toolDefinitions.json to only include fields needed by the UI (36% size reduction)

**Refactoring:**
- Clean up misleading comments that don't match the atomic nature of changes
- Remove unused experimental tool definition generator scripts with poor naming
- Improve code organization with cleaner type definitions

### Technical Details

The main issue was that `otel-semantics-lookup` was using Node.js file system APIs (`readFileSync`, `readdirSync`) which don't work in Cloudflare Workers. We fixed this by:

1. Creating a build script that bundles all 73 OpenTelemetry namespace JSON files into a single TypeScript module
2. Refactoring the lookup module to import pre-generated data instead of reading files at runtime
3. Using npm lifecycle hooks (`prebuild`/`postbuild`) for better build process organization

Additionally, we improved type safety by generating a typed `toolDefinitions.ts` module alongside the JSON file, and simplified the JSON structure to only include what the UI actually uses (name, description, and parameter descriptions).

---
*This PR was created with Claude Code*
author: dcramer

files.patch:
@@ -60,3 +60,6 @@ coverage
 
 # Sentry Config File
 .env.sentry-build-plugin
+
+# Generated files
+packages/mcp-server/src/toolDefinitions.json

@@ -63,6 +63,7 @@
       "default": "./dist/resources.js"
     },
     "./toolDefinitions": {
+      "types": "./dist/toolDefinitions.ts",
       "default": "./dist/toolDefinitions.js"
     },
     "./types": {
@@ -75,12 +76,13 @@
     }
   },
   "scripts": {
-    "build": "tsdown && pnpm run generate-tool-definitions",
+    "prebuild": "pnpm run generate-tool-definitions",
+    "build": "tsdown",
     "dev": "pnpm run generate-tool-definitions && tsc -w",
     "start": "tsx src/index.ts",
     "prepare": "pnpm run build",
-    "test": "pnpm run generate-tool-definitions && vitest",
-    "test:ci": "pnpm run generate-tool-definitions && vitest run --coverage --reporter=junit --outputFile=tests.junit.xml",
+    "test": "vitest",
+    "test:ci": "vitest run --coverage --reporter=junit --outputFile=tests.junit.xml",
     "tsc": "tsc --noEmit",
     "test:watch": "vitest watch",
     "generate-tool-definitions": "tsx scripts/generate-tool-definitions.ts",

@@ -36,6 +36,10 @@ The generation script (`scripts/generate-otel-namespaces.ts`) fetches YAML files
 
 **Caching**: The script caches downloaded YAML files in `.cache/` directory to avoid repeated network requests. Clear the cache to force fresh downloads.
 
+### JSON Import Handling
+
+The JSON files are imported directly in the TypeScript code and bundled by tsdown/rolldown at build time. This approach works seamlessly with Cloudflare Workers since all data is embedded in the JavaScript bundle.
+
 ### Custom Namespaces
 
 Some namespaces are maintained manually for attributes not yet in the OpenTelemetry specification:

context.title: fix: bundle OpenTelemetry data at build time for Cloudflare Workers compatibility
context.description:
## Summary

This PR fixes Cloudflare Workers deployment errors and improves the codebase by bundling OpenTelemetry data at build time and adding proper TypeScript types for tool definitions.

### Changes

**Bug Fixes:**
- Bundle OpenTelemetry namespace data at build time to avoid Node.js file system APIs in Cloudflare Workers
- Fix namespace key generation to replace all hyphens (not just the first) for consistent lookups
- Remove unnecessary type annotations where TypeScript can infer types

**Features:**
- Add native TypeScript types for tool definitions, eliminating type casting in the UI
- Simplify toolDefinitions.json to only include fields needed by the UI (36% size reduction)

**Refactoring:**
- Clean up misleading comments that don't match the atomic nature of changes
- Remove unused experimental tool definition generator scripts with poor naming
- Improve code organization with cleaner type definitions

### Technical Details

The main issue was that `otel-semantics-lookup` was using Node.js file system APIs (`readFileSync`, `readdirSync`) which don't work in Cloudflare Workers. We fixed this by:

1. Creating a build script that bundles all 73 OpenTelemetry namespace JSON files into a single TypeScript module
2. Refactoring the lookup module to import pre-generated data instead of reading files at runtime
3. Using npm lifecycle hooks (`prebuild`/`postbuild`) for better build process organization

Additionally, we improved type safety by generating a typed `toolDefinitions.ts` module alongside the JSON file, and simplified the JSON structure to only include what the UI actually uses (name, description, and parameter descriptions).

---
*This PR was created with Claude Code*
commitMessages:
fix: bundle OpenTelemetry data at build time for Cloudflare Workers compatibility

The otel-semantics-lookup module was using Node.js file system APIs that don't work in Cloudflare Workers. This change:

- Adds a build script to bundle all OTel namespace JSON files into a single TypeScript module
- Refactors the lookup module to import the bundled data instead of reading files at runtime
- Updates build process to use prebuild/postbuild hooks for cleaner dependency management
- Removes unnecessary pretest hook since tests don't use tool definitions
- Updates tests to use actual generated bundle instead of mocks

This fixes the deployment error: "The 'path' argument must be of type string or an instance of URL. Received undefined"

Note: While @rollup/plugin-json would be a cleaner approach, the current solution with generated bundles works well and avoids the need to manually maintain a barrel export file for 73 JSON files.

fix: use tsdown JSON bundling for Cloudflare Workers compatibility

- Replace file system operations in otel-semantics-lookup with direct JSON imports
- Remove complex loading functions, Zod parsing, and caching (JSON imports are type-safe)
- Update generate-tool-definitions to output JSON and run as prebuild
- Add TypeScript wrapper for toolDefinitions to ensure proper bundling
- Remove obsolete generate-otel-data-bundle script
- Update package.json exports to point to correct bundled files

This fixes Cloudflare Workers deployment by eliminating Node.js-specific APIs
and leveraging tsdown/rolldown's built-in JSON support.

fix: add proper TypeScript types for tool definitions

- Add ToolDefinition and ToolParameter interfaces to toolDefinitions.ts
- Fix type errors in mcp-cloudflare home.tsx by using proper types
- Fix OpenTelemetry examples display to handle complex types via JSON.stringify
- Fix lint errors in script files by using node: protocol

Generated with Claude Code

fix: remove unnecessary type annotations in home.tsx

TOOL_DEFINITIONS is already properly typed from the import, so explicit type annotations in sort() and map() callbacks are redundant.

chore: remove unused experimental tool definition generator scripts

These were created during TypeScript generation experiments but are not
being used. Only generate-tool-definitions.ts is actually referenced in
package.json scripts.

fix: remove unused type imports in home.tsx

Since we no longer use explicit type annotations, the ToolDefinition and
ToolParameter type imports are unnecessary.

fix: clean up misleading comments

- Remove TypeScript mention from generate-tool-definitions.ts (this PR is about bundling for Cloudflare)
- Remove unnecessary comments about re-exporting and typing in toolDefinitions.ts
- Simplify the examples mapping code in otel-semantics-lookup.ts

feat: add Zod validation for toolDefinitions.json

- Use Zod schemas to parse and validate toolDefinitions.json at runtime
- Replace manual TypeScript interfaces with z.infer for type safety
- Add safeParse with clear error messages for better debugging
- Export schemas for potential reuse in other parts of the codebase

This ensures the JSON structure matches our expected types and catches
any mismatches at build time rather than runtime.

refactor: use @types/json-schema for tool definitions

- Replace complex Zod validation with proper JSON Schema v7 types
- Use type assertion since we trust the build process generates valid data
- Much cleaner and more maintainable approach
- Addresses feedback about the previous implementation being "disgusting"

fix: replace all hyphens in namespace names for consistent lookups

The Cursor BugBot correctly identified that namespace.replace('-', '_') only
replaces the first hyphen. This could cause lookup failures for namespaces
with multiple hyphens (e.g., 'feature-flags-test' would become
'feature_flags-test' but lookup expects 'feature_flags_test').

Fixed by using replace(/-/g, '_') to replace all hyphens.

refactor: simplify toolDefinitions.json to only include UI-needed fields

The UI only uses name, description, and parameter descriptions. Removed
unnecessary JSON Schema fields like $schema, anyOf, type, etc. This
reduces the file size by 36% (from ~47K to ~30K) and makes the structure
much cleaner.

- Simplified ToolParameter interface to only include description
- Updated generation script to extract only descriptions
- Removed dependency on @types/json-schema

chore: remove generated toolDefinitions.json from source control

This file is auto-generated during the prebuild step and shouldn't be
tracked in git. It's already listed in .gitignore but was previously
committed. Since the build process is required before tests/publish,
there's no need to track this generated file.
